Description: Sherd (wall). With scrolls or flutes and cross-hatched decoration. Made of black decorated and cobalt stained pottery (pink-grey).
Bibliographic references: Wallis 1891 / Persian Ceramic Art Belonging to Mr F DuCane Godman, FRS: The Thirteenth Century Lustred Vases (Appendix pl.vii.3)
Gibbs 1994 / Mamluk Underglaze-Decorated Wares: Some Evidence from Fustat (fig.27)
